bibl.title: Pharaonic Alexandria: Ezekhiel's 'Exagogé' and Political Allegory in Hellenistic Judaism.
bibl.note: Argues that Ezekhiel's 'Exagogé' is an allegorical commentary of Hellenistic Alexandria and of the life of the Jewish community in Alexandria. - Avec résumé en anglais.

bibl.title: The Space of the City in Graeco-Roman Egypt. Image and Reality

bibl.seg: Tim Whitmarsh, Pharaonic Alexandria: Ezekhiel's 'Exagogé' and Political Allegory in Hellenistic Judaism.
Eva Subías, Pedro Azara, Jesús Carruesco, Ignacio Fiz & Rosa Cuesta (edd.), The Space of the City in Graeco-Roman Egypt. Image and Reality = Documenta. 22 (Tarragona, 2011) pp. 41-48; - 219-220.
Argues that Ezekhiel's 'Exagogé' is an allegorical commentary of Hellenistic Alexandria and of the life of the Jewish community in Alexandria. - Avec résumé en anglais.
